id: issuer that issues securities that are excused from certain regulatory reporting requirements
name: issuer that issues securities that are excused from certain regulatory reporting requirements

id: Securities are typically issued in one of two forms, registered or bearer. Most securities issued today are in registered form, which enables the issuing firm or registrar to keep records of a security's owner and mail them any dividend, coupon, or other payments. Registered securities may be issued in book entry (digital only) or certificate (physical) form, but most today are entirely digital.
name: Securities are typically issued in one of two forms, registered or bearer. Most securities issued today are in registered form, which enables the issuing firm or registrar to keep records of a security's owner and mail them any dividend, coupon, or other payments. Registered securities may be issued in book entry (digital only) or certificate (physical) form, but most today are entirely digital.

id: Barron's Dictionary of Finance and Investment Terms, Ninth Edition, 2014.
name: Barron's Dictionary of Finance and Investment Terms, Ninth Edition, 2014.

id: form1-a.pdf for the actual form detail
name: form1-a.pdf for the actual form detail

name: version of this ontology was modified to clarify the definition of isIssuedInForm.

name: securities offering whereby the underwriter purchases the securities outright for their own account

id: offering of securities made privately to a limited number of qualified potential investors
name: offering of securities made privately to a limited number of qualified potential investors

id: de minimis transactions, fiduciary transactions, transactions with financial institutions, private placement transactions that meet certain conditions, and so forth.
name: de minimis transactions, fiduciary transactions, transactions with financial institutions, private placement transactions that meet certain conditions, and so forth.

id: indicates a number of shares or units
name: indicates a number of shares or units

id: indicates the form in which the security is issued, typically in registered form
name: indicates the form in which the security is issued, typically in registered form

id: offering of securities for sale to the investment public, after compliance with registration requirements of the relevant regulatory authorities
name: offering of securities for sale to the investment public, after compliance with registration requirements of the relevant regulatory authorities

id: There are many variations, including offering memorandum, which is typically used in the context of a private placement, offering statement, which has slightly different meanings depending on the context (for securities, for bonds, etc.) and so forth. This concept is intended to act as a more abstract parent for these more nuanced concepts.
name: There are many variations, including offering memorandum, which is typically used in the context of a private placement, offering statement, which has slightly different meanings depending on the context (for securities, for bonds, etc.) and so forth. This concept is intended to act as a more abstract parent for these more nuanced concepts.

name: indicates the series identified by the issuer in the event that the instrument is issued in several series (also known as tranches)

id: SecuritiesIssuance.rdf version of the ontology was modified to replace concepts from several FIBO FND ontologies with their counterparts added to the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) v1.1.
name: SecuritiesIssuance.rdf version of the ontology was modified to replace concepts from several FIBO FND ontologies with their counterparts added to the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) v1.1.

id: version of this ontology was modified to add the concept of the form the security is issued in, namely bearer or registered.
name: version of this ontology was modified to add the concept of the form the security is issued in, namely bearer or registered.

id: With registered securities, a ledger is kept by the issuing company or agent which records the owners of all the securities. Transfer of ownership can only occur when names are changed in the ledger.
name: With registered securities, a ledger is kept by the issuing company or agent which records the owners of all the securities. Transfer of ownership can only occur when names are changed in the ledger.

id: Underwriting is the process by which investment bankers raise investment capital from investors on behalf of corporations and governments that are issuing either equity or debt securities.
name: Underwriting is the process by which investment bankers raise investment capital from investors on behalf of corporations and governments that are issuing either equity or debt securities.

id: relates a financial instrument or FISN to an ISO 18774-compliant instrument description, that is, a collection of characteristics and attributes defining a financial instrument with a maximum length up to 19 alphanumeric characters
name: relates a financial instrument or FISN to an ISO 18774-compliant instrument description, that is, a collection of characteristics and attributes defining a financial instrument with a maximum length up to 19 alphanumeric characters

id: Such an offering may be considered exempt either because the issuer is exempt or the transaction specific to the offering is exempt.
name: Such an offering may be considered exempt either because the issuer is exempt or the transaction specific to the offering is exempt.

id: the type of distribution for a securities offering, including (1) primary offering - the original sale of a company's securities, in which the proceeds from the sale are received directly by the company, and (2) secondary offering - an offering of a security that has been issued previously
name: the type of distribution for a securities offering, including (1) primary offering - the original sale of a company's securities, in which the proceeds from the sale are received directly by the company, and (2) secondary offering - an offering of a security that has been issued previously

id: This ontology defines the fundamental concepts for issuing securities, including securities offering, offering document, offering statement, securities underwriter, prospectus, and so forth.
name: This ontology defines the fundamental concepts for issuing securities, including securities offering, offering document, offering statement, securities underwriter, prospectus, and so forth.

id: If the offering is public, then it can only be made after regulatory registration requirements have been met. The securities may be new or a secondary offering of a previously issued security, and may include stock, multiple classes of equity shares, municipal or other government bonds, and so forth. Offerings, especially to the investment public, are typically made by an investment banker, or syndicate of investment bankers.
name: If the offering is public, then it can only be made after regulatory registration requirements have been met. The securities may be new or a secondary offering of a previously issued security, and may include stock, multiple classes of equity shares, municipal or other government bonds, and so forth. Offerings, especially to the investment public, are typically made by an investment banker, or syndicate of investment bankers.

id: In general, these include governments and issuers of tax exempt securities such as municipalities, banks and depository institutions, and authorized insurance companies, railroads and public utilities, and certain non-profit organizations.
name: In general, these include governments and issuers of tax exempt securities such as municipalities, banks and depository institutions, and authorized insurance companies, railroads and public utilities, and certain non-profit organizations.

id: form of a security that is not categorized
name: form of a security that is not categorized

id: An announcement date may also refer to the release of a corporate event or new financial news, such as interest rate changes or earnings reports.
name: An announcement date may also refer to the release of a corporate event or new financial news, such as interest rate changes or earnings reports.

id: securities offering whereby investment bankers commit to doing their best to sell the securities offered, but do not assume the full risk of an underwriter
name: securities offering whereby investment bankers commit to doing their best to sell the securities offered, but do not assume the full risk of an underwriter

id: security that can be converted into another security
name: security that can be converted into another security

id: Unlike normal registered instruments, no record is kept of who owns bearer instruments or of transactions involving the transfer of ownership.
name: Unlike normal registered instruments, no record is kept of who owns bearer instruments or of transactions involving the transfer of ownership.

id: nature of the proof of ownership of a security
name: nature of the proof of ownership of a security

id: abbreviated name for a financial instrument within a defined structure as specified in ISO 18774
name: abbreviated name for a financial instrument within a defined structure as specified in ISO 18774

id: contract terms specifying when and how a security may be converted to another security (usually of the same issuer)
name: contract terms specifying when and how a security may be converted to another security (usually of the same issuer)

id: ISO 10962:2019(E), Securities and related financial instruments - Classification of financial instruments (CFI) code, Fourth edition, 2019-10, clause 6.2.2
name: ISO 10962:2019(E), Securities and related financial instruments - Classification of financial instruments (CFI) code, Fourth edition, 2019-10, clause 6.2.2

id: public offering involving securities that are excused from certain regulatory reporting requirements
name: public offering involving securities that are excused from certain regulatory reporting requirements

id: In the United States, a prospectus may be a formal legal document, required by and filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission, if it provides details about an investment offering for sale to the public.
name: In the United States, a prospectus may be a formal legal document, required by and filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission, if it provides details about an investment offering for sale to the public.

id: An offering memorandum serves to provide buyers with information on the offering and to protect the sellers from the liability associated with selling unregistered securities. It includes information such as the financial statements, management biographies, a detailed description of the business, etc.
name: An offering memorandum serves to provide buyers with information on the offering and to protect the sellers from the liability associated with selling unregistered securities. It includes information such as the financial statements, management biographies, a detailed description of the business, etc.

id: Sales may be made either directly or through third-party dealers.
name: Sales may be made either directly or through third-party dealers.

id: underwriting agreement between an organization (typically an investment bank) and a securities issuer that commits the underwriter to assuming risk involved in buying a new issue of securities and reselling it to the public
name: underwriting agreement between an organization (typically an investment bank) and a securities issuer that commits the underwriter to assuming risk involved in buying a new issue of securities and reselling it to the public

id: form of a security in which ownership is recorded electronically by a central depository
name: form of a security in which ownership is recorded electronically by a central depository

id: In a best efforts offering, the agreement is strictly an agency arrangement, with no obligation on the part of the agent to purchase the securities. They act as a broker, in other words.
name: In a best efforts offering, the agreement is strictly an agency arrangement, with no obligation on the part of the agent to purchase the securities. They act as a broker, in other words.

id: offering memorandum that conforms to Regulation A, Offering Statement, of the Securities Act of 1933
name: offering memorandum that conforms to Regulation A, Offering Statement, of the Securities Act of 1933

name: SecuritiesIssuance.rdf version of this ontology was modified to normalize the representation of security forms (all individuals rather than a mixed representation).

id: indicates the date on which the first trade of a newly issued security is settled
name: indicates the date on which the first trade of a newly issued security is settled

name: relates a security to its ISO 18774-compliant short name, which includes an issuer short name, abbreviated instrument characteristics, and abbreviated instrument description per the ISO standard

id: form of a security whereby ownership is recorded in the name of the owner on the books of the issuer or the issuer's registrar and can only be transferred to another owner when endorsed by the registered owner
name: form of a security whereby ownership is recorded in the name of the owner on the books of the issuer or the issuer's registrar and can only be transferred to another owner when endorsed by the registered owner

id: legal document stating the objectives, risks and terms of investment involved with a private placement
name: legal document stating the objectives, risks and terms of investment involved with a private placement

id: or relevant state regulators, unless the issuer is an exempt issuer, and are usually conducted by an investment banker or a syndicate made up of several investment bankers, at a price agreed upon between the issuer and the investment bankers.
name: or relevant state regulators, unless the issuer is an exempt issuer, and are usually conducted by an investment banker or a syndicate made up of several investment bankers, at a price agreed upon between the issuer and the investment bankers.

id: Warrants are equity convertible securities. They give the owner the option to buy newly issued shares at a determined exercise price and date.
name: Warrants are equity convertible securities. They give the owner the option to buy newly issued shares at a determined exercise price and date.

id: version of this ontology was modified to refine the concept of a securities underwriter.
name: version of this ontology was modified to refine the concept of a securities underwriter.

name: indicates whether or not the subscription is over-subscribed

name: version of this ontology was modified to add book entry form as a kind of registered security, make registered security a class with two individuals, namely book entry and 'bearer and registered', and clean up definitions to eliminate ambiguity where possible and conform to ISO 704.

name: A prospectus may specify the facts about an offering of securities, mutual funds, or limited partnerships for investments in oil, gas, equipment leasing, or other kinds of limited partnerships.

id: Unlike a public offering, a private placement does not have to be registered with a regulatory agency if the securities are purchased for investment rather than resale.
name: Unlike a public offering, a private placement does not have to be registered with a regulatory agency if the securities are purchased for investment rather than resale.

name: indicates a period of time in which investors can commit to purchase shares (or units) to be issued

name: relates a security issuer or FISN to an ISO 18774-compliant issuer short name, that is, an abbreviation of the official issuer name, limited to a maximum of 15 alphanumeric characters

name: party that has purchased from an issuer with a view to, or sells for an issuer in connection with, the distribution of any security, or participates or has a direct or indirect participation in any such undertaking, or participates or has a participation in the direct or indirect underwriting of any such undertaking
